results.title: Indiscreet
results.brief_description: A NATO officer meets a beautiful actress and falls in love with her, but protects himself by saying he is married. The script of this film was written by Norman Krasna, based on his play “Kind Sir”. It stars Cary Grant and Ingrid Bergman.

results.title: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Walter Wanger and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: Tense and atmospheric tale of alien duplicates who gradually hatch from pods and take over the inhabitants of a small town. Based on the novel by Jack Finney. Stars Kevin McCarthy and Dana Wynter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Siegel, Walter Wanger and Allied Artists Pictures

results.title: La Traviata
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Tarak Ben Ammar, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Accent Films
results.brief_description: This is Zeffirelli’s lavish production of Verdi’s much-loved opera, “La Traviata”, starring Teresa Stratas and Placido Domingo. Violetta Valery is giving a party to celebrate her return to society after an illness - here she meets Alfredo, son of a wealthy merchant, and they fall in love. They live happily together until Alfredo’s father comes to Violetta and asks her to end the affair in order to spare his family further dishonour. The heartbreak destroys Violetta’s health completely, and Alfredo realises what Violetta has sacrificed - but it is too late!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Zeffirelli, Tarak Ben Ammar, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Accent Films

results.title: The Band Wagon
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A has-been Hollywood dancer joins forces with a temperamental stage producer to put on a Broadway musical. “The Band Wagon” has a witty, original screenplay, with some of the most exciting musical numbers ever put on film. Stars Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse with Jack Buchanan, Oscar Levant and Nanette Fabray.

results.title: Possessed
results.brief_description: Marion, a factory worker from Pennsylvania, has a glimpse of the high life and goes to New York to find such a life for herself. Marian is a quick learner and it is not long before she becomes mistress of a rich prominent lawyer, Mark Whitney. “Possessed” is a fascinating, trenchant drama with a strong screenplay based on the play “The mirage” by Edgar Selwyn. Stars Joan Crawford and Clark Cable.

results.title: The Little Mermaid
results.creator_credit: Ron Clements, John Musker, Howard Ashman and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Mermaids are supposed to stay under the sea, but there was never a mermaid quite like Ariel. The headstrong teenager longs to be part of the magical world on land, much to the dismay of her father, King Triton. When she falls in love with a human Prince, Ariel looks to Ursula, a sea witch. With the help of her friends, Ariel must win her Prince’s love in a thrilling race against time. This production of “The Little Mermaid”, based on the fairytale by Hans Christian Andersen, is full of dazzling animation and is a treasure for all ages. Cast features the voices of Rene Auberjonois, Buddy hackett, Jason Marin, Christopher Daniel Barnes, Jodie Benson, Kenneth Mars.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Clements, John Musker, Howard Ashman and Walt Disney Pictures
results.description:
The mermaid princess Ariel dreams of the surface world shimmering above the ocean. The passing ships churn waves of curiosity in their wake, and she spends her days collecting the trinkets that wash overboard with Flounder. Too bad her father, King Triton, forbids her to explore the surface, preferring she enchant their underwater subjects with her miraculous singing voice. Out of all the king’s daughters, Ariel’s voice is the most majestic, a fact that riles the sea witch Ursula.

When one of those passing ships catches fire, Ariel swims to the rescue, saving the charming Prince Eric from drowning. When he awakes, dreaming of the woman who saved him and not realising it was a mermaid, Ariels sees her opportunity to follow her dreams. The only problem are her fins; she can’t join Prince Eric above the ocean. Ursula offers a devil’s bargain that could solve all Ariel’s problems though, for a price.

Brimming with charming underwater characters, a headstrong princess and unforgettable musical numbers, The Little Mermaid is one of the most iconic movies of all time. Not only did it endear itself to audiences around the world, it helped usher in the Disney renaissance, an era of unparalleled critical and commercial success that led to Aladdin (1992), Beauty and the Beast (1991) and the The Lion King (1994).

The above concept sketch from legendary animator Glenn Keane demonstrates all of Ariel’s wide-eyed will and exuberance and serves as a prototype of a famous shot from the iconic song “Part of Your World”.

results.title: Ninotchka
results.brief_description: The ads proclaimed “Garbo laughs!” and back in that banner movie year of 1939, moviegoers everywhere joined in the laughter as the legendary actress starred in her first romantic comedy, “Ninotchka”. Garbo plays a dour, severe Soviet official who comes to Paris on business involving the the sale of some Czarist jewels. Soon business turns to pleasure as she discovers the special magic of Paris and succumbs to the charms of a suave Frenchman named Leon D’Algout (Melvyn Douglas).

results.title: Fanny By Gaslight
results.creator_credit: Anthony Asquith, Edward Black, Gainsborough Pictures and GFD
results.brief_description: The illegitimate daughter of a British cabinet minister, in the latter half of the 19th century, begins a new life as a lady’s maid in her real father’s household. She learns the facts of her parentage and a strong affection develops between her and her father. When his wife learns the truth and threatens a public scandal, he commits suicide. Starring James Mason and Phyllis Calvert. Based on the novel by Michael Sadleir.

results.title: Beat the devil
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Jack Clayton, Santana and Romulus Films
results.brief_description: The story of a motley group of swindlers travelling on an Africa-bound tramp steamer. The plot unfolds to reveal a web of double crossing and deception as each attempts to get their hands on a fortune in uranium deposits. Starring Gina Lollobrigida and Humphrey Bogart. Written by Truman Capote and John Huston from a novel by James Helvick.

results.title: Bob Dylan: Don't Look Back
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, Albert Grossman, Ashes and Sand and Pennebaker Associates
results.brief_description: An intriguing film biography which captures Dylan during his 1965 English tour. It includes many private moments as well as the public performances. The cast features Joan Baez and Donovan, and tracks include, “Subterranean Homesick Blues”, “The Times They Are A’ Changin’”, and “It’s Alright Ma”.
